title: Way Out Alliance
text:
The Way Out Alliance (; "YELK Dashink, YELQ") or Yelk Alliance or simply Yelk or Way Out was a <a href="Liberalism">liberal</a> <a href="political%20alliance">political alliance</a> of three political parties in <a href="Armenia">Armenia</a>: <a href="Civil%20Contract%20%28Armenia%29">Civil Contract</a>, <a href="Bright%20Armenia">Bright Armenia</a> and the <a href="Hanrapetutyun%20Party">Hanrapetutyun Party</a>. It was formed on 12 December 2016, before the <a href="2017%20Armenian%20parliamentary%20election">2017 Armenian parliamentary election</a>. Its leaders were <a href="Edmon%20Marukyan">Edmon Marukyan</a> (leader of Bright Armenia), <a href="Nikol%20Pashinyan">Nikol Pashinyan</a> (leader of Civil Contract), and <a href="Aram%20Sargsyan">Aram Sargsyan</a> (leader of Hanrapetutyun and former <a href="Prime%20Minister%20of%20Armenia">Prime Minister of Armenia</a>). The alliance was dissolved on 12 September 2018 after its constituent parties agreed to participate in the <a href="2018%20Armenian%20parliamentary%20election">2018 parliamentary elections</a> separately.
History.
On 2 April 2017, the alliance participated in the <a href="2017%20Armenian%20parliamentary%20election">2017 Armenian parliamentary election</a> with <a href="Edmon%20Marukyan">Edmon Marukyan</a> as leader of the alliance and won 9 seats out of 105 in the <a href="National%20Assembly%20%28Armenia%29">National Assembly</a>. Prior to the election, the <a href="Union%20for%20National%20Self-Determination">Union for National Self-Determination</a>, another liberal Pro-European party, also wished to join the Way Out Alliance, however their request was never responded too.
After parliamentary elections, the alliance participated in the <a href="2017%20Yerevan%20City%20Council%20election">2017 Yerevan City Council election</a>. The alliance's candidate for <a href="Mayor%20of%20Yerevan">Mayor of Yerevan</a> was <a href="Nikol%20Pashinyan">Nikol Pashinyan</a>. However, the alliance won only 14 seats out of 65 in the <a href="Yerevan%20City%20Council">Yerevan City Council</a> and Nikol Pashinyan gave up his mandate of City Council and continued his work in the National Assembly as an MP.
The alliance did not participate in the <a href="2018%20Yerevan%20City%20Council%20election">2018 Yerevan City Council election</a>. <a href="Bright%20Armenia">Bright Armenia</a> and the <a href="Hanrapetutyun%20Party">Hanrapetutyun Party</a> formed another alliance - <a href="Bright%20Alliance">Bright Alliance</a>. Meanwhile, <a href="Civil%20Contract%20%28Armenia%29">Civil Contract</a> formed the <a href="My%20Step%20Alliance">My Step Alliance</a> with the <a href="Mission%20Party">Mission Party</a>. The My Step Alliance won the municipal elections and their candidate <a href="Hayk%20Marutyan">Hayk Marutyan</a> was appointed as the Mayor of Yerevan. Bright Alliance came in third place, winning 3 seats out of 65 in the Yerevan City Council.
Ideology.
The Way Out Alliance's ideology is based on <a href="liberalism">liberalism</a>. The three parties, especially Bright Armenia and Hanrapetutyun, are considerably pro-European and support Armenia's <a href="European%20integration">European integration</a>. In terms of <a href="Foreign%20relations%20of%20Armenia">Foreign relations of Armenia</a>, the alliance stated that Armenia's decision to join the <a href="Eurasian%20Economic%20Union">Eurasian Economic Union</a> was wrong and had a negative impact on the country. The alliance proposed to renegotiate with the <a href="European%20Union">EU</a> on signing an Association Agreement along with a <a href="Deep%20and%20Comprehensive%20Free%20Trade%20Area">Deep and Comprehensive Free Trade Agreement</a>.
